title.narrative: 4.2 INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: By 2017, institutional capacity to implement child protection legislation, policies and standards to protect children and women from abuse exploitation and violence is strengthened., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children's rights to protection from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect are being addressed through system reform and strengthening of child protection systems at national and provincial levels.

title.narrative: of strategies supporting child protection outcomes notified, with costing and operational plan

of standards, rules, guidelines, curricula and by-laws endorsed by competent authority
children and women accessing social service models that promote a protective environment
of provinces/areas with Child Protection Welfare Commission/Authority established as public administrative structure

districts with Child Protection Units as part of the public child protection system with minimum 3 of 4 quality assessment points (Established in accordance with relevant child protection provincial legislation (2 pts), Implementing SOPs and Guidelines in line with minimum standards (1pt), Registering and Referring cases with disaggregated data available (m/f and category) (1pt))
of provinces/areas where Public Authorities maintain child protection specific data
